headline: Comcast Urges More Civil Dialogue After Kirk’s Death
summary: Comcast called for its staff “to do better” in fostering civil dialogue following Matthew Dowd’s on-air comments on MSNBC suggesting that Charlie Kirk’s “awful words” led to his being shot.  “We should be able to disagree, robustly and passionately, but, ultimately, with respect,” executives Brian Roberts, Mike Cavanagh and Mark Lazarus wrote.  Comcast plans to spin off many of its NBCUniversal cable networks, including MSNBC, later this year.

raw.headline: Comcast Urges More Civil Dialogue After Kirk’s Death

Comcast plans to spin off many of its NBCUniversal cable networks, including MSNBC, later this year.
